title: Google\Cloud\GkeMultiCloud\V1\AwsControlPlane
name: AwsControlPlane
description:
ControlPlane defines common parameters between control plane nodes.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.gkemulticloud.v1.AwsControlPlane

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.version
params.description: Required. The Kubernetes version to run on control plane replicas (e.g. 1.19.10-gke.1000). You can list all supported versions on a given Google Cloud region by calling [GetAwsServerConfig][google.cloud.gkemulticloud.v1.AwsClusters.GetAwsServerConfig].

params.name: data.instance_type
params.description: Optional. The AWS instance type. When unspecified, it uses a default based on the cluster's version.

params.name: data.ssh_config
params.description: Optional. SSH configuration for how to access the underlying control plane machines.

params.name: data.subnet_ids
params.description: Required. The list of subnets where control plane replicas will run. A replica will be provisioned on each subnet and up to three values can be provided. Each subnet must be in a different AWS Availability Zone (AZ).

params.name: data.security_group_ids
params.description: Optional. The IDs of additional security groups to add to control plane replicas. The Anthos Multi-Cloud API will automatically create and manage security groups with the minimum rules needed for a functioning cluster.

params.name: data.iam_instance_profile
params.description: Required. The name or ARN of the AWS IAM instance profile to assign to each control plane replica.

params.name: data.root_volume
params.description: Optional. Configuration related to the root volume provisioned for each control plane replica. Volumes will be provisioned in the availability zone associated with the corresponding subnet. When unspecified, it defaults to 32 GiB with the GP2 volume type.

params.name: data.main_volume
params.description: Optional. Configuration related to the main volume provisioned for each control plane replica. The main volume is in charge of storing all of the cluster's etcd state. Volumes will be provisioned in the availability zone associated with the corresponding subnet. When unspecified, it defaults to 8 GiB with the GP2 volume type.

params.name: data.database_encryption
params.description: Required. The ARN of the AWS KMS key used to encrypt cluster secrets.

params.name: data.tags
params.description: Optional. A set of AWS resource tags to propagate to all underlying managed AWS resources. Specify at most 50 pairs containing alphanumerics, spaces, and symbols (.+-=_:@/). Keys can be up to 127 Unicode characters. Values can be up to 255 Unicode characters.

params.name: data.aws_services_authentication
params.description: Required. Authentication configuration for management of AWS resources.

params.name: data.proxy_config
params.description: Optional. Proxy configuration for outbound HTTP(S) traffic.

params.name: data.config_encryption
params.description: Required. Config encryption for user data.

params.name: data.instance_placement
params.description: Optional. The placement to use on control plane instances. When unspecified, the VPC's default tenancy will be used.

methods.name: getVersion
methods.description:
Required. The Kubernetes version to run on control plane replicas (e.g. 1.19.10-gke.1000).

You can list all supported versions on a given Google Cloud region by calling [GetAwsServerConfig][google.cloud.gkemulticloud.v1.AwsClusters.GetAwsServerConfig].
